required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Baricitinib in Participants From 2 Years to Less Than 18 Years Old With Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Withdrawal, Safety and Efficacy Study of Oral Baricitinib in Patients From 2 Years to Less Than 18 Years Old With Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis (JIA)

brief_summary.textblock: The reason for this study is to see if the study drug baricitinib given orally is safe and effective in participants with JIA from 2 years to less than 18 years old.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Achieving Pediatric American College of Rheumatology 30 responder index (PedACR30)
Proportion of Participants with Inactive Disease
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with inactive disease

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants with Minimal Disease Activity
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with minimal disease activity

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Juvenile Arthritis Disease Activity Score (JADAS)-27
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in juvenile arthritis disease activity score

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Arthritis-Related Pain Severity as Measured by the Childhood Health Assessment Questionnaire (CHAQ) Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Item
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in arthritis-related pain severity as measured by the CHAQ pain VAS item

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in PASI score

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Spondyloarthritis Research Consortium of Canada (SPARCC) Enthesitis Index
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in SPARCC enthesitis index

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Juvenile Spondyloarthritis Disease Activity Index (JSpADA)
Pharmacokinetics (PK): Maximum Plasma Baricitinib Concentration at Steady-State (Cmax, ss)
PK: Area Under the Baricitinib Concentration-Time Curve at Steady-State (AUC, ss)
Change from Baseline in Immunophenotyping (T Cells)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in immunophenotyping (T Cells)

Participants were evaluated for baricitinib acceptability using a 5-category questionnaire. Participants were asked to answer one of the following to describe the ease of use of baricitinib: Very difficult (or hard), difficult (or hard), neither easy nor hard, easy, or very easy.

Participants were evaluated for baricitinib palatability using a 5-category questionnaire. Participants were asked to answer one of the following to describe the taste and smell of baricitinib: Disliked very much, disliked, neither liked nor disliked, liked, or like very much.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants must have had a diagnosis of active JIA (polyarticular, extended oligoarticular, or enthesitis-related juvenile idiopathic arthritis [ERA] including JPsA).
- Participants must have had an inadequate response to at least one conventional or biologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants must not have systemic JIA, with or without active systemic features.
- Participants must not have persistent oligoarticular arthritis.
- Participants must not have been previously treated with a Janus kinase (JAK) inhibitor.

link.description: A Study of Baricitinib in Participants From 2 Years to Less Than 18 Years Old With Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
